description:
The Technical Steward for the OM3 segment is Orders and Observations.

This segment applies to free text and other non-numeric data types.

1.name: Sequence Number - Test/Observation Master File
1.description: This field contains the same value as the sequence number of the associated OM1 segment.

2.name: Preferred Coding System
2.description: This field contains the observations whose categorical responses are taken from a specified table of codes (e.g., CWE data types). Record the preferred coding system for this observation (e.g., ICD9, SNOMED III). Take the codes from ASTM Table 3 or 5, or specify a local code.

3.name: Valid Coded 'Answers'
3.description: This field contains a list of valid coded answers. In the case that the list of coded answers is easily enumerated, list the valid coded answers for this observation here using the preferred coding system given in OM3-2 - Preferred Coding System. If, for example, the given observation was VDRL, the valid answers might be non-reactive, 86^ intermediate, and 87^ reactive.

4.name: Normal Text/Codes for Categorical Observations
4.description: Certain observations/tests with a nature code of A or C (see OM1-18 - Nature of Service/Test/Observation) have text (alpha) results (e.g., reactive, nonreactive). Alpha normals for those tests should be entered in this field (e.g., "nonreactive").

5.name: Abnormal Text/Codes for Categorical Observations
5.description: This field contains the list of the text answers that are abnormal for the test.

6.name: Critical Text/Codes for Categorical Observations
6.description: This field contains the list of coded results that are critically abnormal for this observation.

7.name: Value Type
7.description: This field contains the allowed data type for a single categorical observation (code A or C in OM1-18 - Nature of Observation). Refer to HL7 table 0125 - Value type for valid values.
7.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables
